definition[0]: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
example[0]: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
definition[1]: to make someone worry or make them sad
example[1]: Clare was haunted by the fear that her husband was having an affair.
definition[2]: to cause problems for someone over a long period of time
example[2]: an error that would come back to haunt them for years to come
definition[3]: a place that someone likes to go to often
example[3]: The Caf√© Vienna was a favourite haunt of journalists and actors.
